item.description:
Artist Talk: David Hume Kennerly, Pulitzer Prize Winning Photographer
Veterans Day, Sunday, November 11, 2pm
Free admission for Veterans, 11am-5pm
Free event (Pre-Registration recommended)
Register online

David Hume Kennerly will speak about his Pulitzer Prize-winning photograph on display in Kennedy to
Kent State, placing the show in direct personal and historical context. Kennerly won the 1972 Pulitzer
Prize for Feature Photography for his portfolio of photographs taken of the Vietnam War and other
subjects. Following Nixon's resignation, Kennerly was named Chief White House Photographer
during the Ford administration. Sponsored by MassHumanities.

 

 

Please Note:   Event is Free, Will take place at WAM.

Event will be held at the Worcester Art Museum, in the Conference Room.

There are still openings remaining at this time.

Please sign up at WAM by contacting Elaine Cowan  Phone: 508.793.4333 or 508.793.4334  Email: elainecowan@worcesterart.org

 

Scott and I will be checking out the show "Kennedy to Kent State" at the Worcester Art Museum on Sunday Nov 11th. If anyone would like to join us you are welcome to meet us in the Lancaster lobby of the Museum at 12 noon. We will then be attending the lecture (which this announcement will lead you to the details.) Admission to the Museum for non members is 14.00 free to members. The Lecture is free.

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: WAM- Artist Talk: David Hume Kennerly, Pulitzer Prize Winning Photographer
